thread.title_full: E-N Game of the Week: (1) Steele vs. (2) Judson - San Antonio Express-News

author: Ben Baby
title: E-N Game of the Week: (1) Steele vs. (2) Judson -
text:
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 6 6 Rockets running back Sincere McCormick flies into the open in the first quarter as Judson hosts New Braunfels at Rutledge Stadium on Oct. 9, 2015. Rockets running back Sincere McCormick flies into the open in the first quarter as Judson hosts New Braunfels at Rutledge Stadium on Oct. 9, 2015. Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Image 2 of 6 Jay Miller of Judson scores during high school football action against Brennan at Farris Stadium on Sept. 17, 2015. Jay Miller of Judson scores during high school football action against Brennan at Farris Stadium on Sept. 17, 2015. Photo: Billy Calzada /San Antonio Express-News Image 3 of 6 Judson’s Mi’Kel Jackson scores a touchdown ahead of Wagner’s Tre’Vonte Lott (top) and Damante Johnson during first half action on Oct. 2, 2015 at Rutledge Stadium. Judson’s Mi’Kel Jackson scores a touchdown ahead of Wagner’s Tre’Vonte Lott (top) and Damante Johnson during first half action on Oct. 2, 2015 at Rutledge Stadium. Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Image 4 of 6 Steele QB Xavier Martin appeared to have a long TD run but the play was called back due to a penalty during a District 25-6A high school football game against Clemens at Lehnhoff Stadium on Oct. 2, 2015. Steele QB Xavier Martin appeared to have a long TD run but the play was called back due to a penalty during a District 25-6A high school football game against Clemens at Lehnhoff Stadium on Oct. 2, 2015. Photo: Ron Cortes /For The Express-News Image 5 of 6 Judson’s James Tonsall (left) tries to bring down Steele’s C.J. Williams during the first half of their game at Rutledge Stadium on Oct. 24, 2014. Judson’s James Tonsall (left) tries to bring down Steele’s C.J. Williams during the first half of their game at Rutledge Stadium on Oct. 24, 2014. Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer /San Antonio Express-News Image 6 of 6 Knights receiver Antoine Cox Wesley yanks in a pass behind DeSoto’s A.J. Green at Mary Hardin-Baylor’s Crusader Stadium in Belton on Sept. 17, 2015. Knights receiver Antoine Cox Wesley yanks in a pass behind DeSoto’s A.J. Green at Mary Hardin-Baylor’s Crusader Stadium in Belton on Sept. 17, 2015. Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News E-N Game of the Week: (1) Steele vs. (2) Judson 1 / 6 Back to Gallery Judson at Steele
Kickoff: 7:30 p.m. Friday, Lehnhoff Stadium
Radio: KLUP-AM 930
E-N Area rankings/records: 6A No. 2 Judson (7-0, 3-0 District 25-6) 6A; No. 1 Steele (8-0, 4-0 District 25-6A)
Coaches: Sean McAuliffe (17-5 career, two seasons, all at Judson); Scott Lehnhoff (Scott Lehnhoff (33-4, three seasons, all at Steele)
Series: Steele leads 5-0.
Last meeting: Steele won 23-22 in 2014.
Judson breakdown
Setting the scene: Judson came close to handing Steele a rare district loss in a game that ended up being a turning point for the Rockets. After a shaky start to the season, Judson reached the Class 6A Division I state semifinals. The Rockets are tied with Steele atop the 25-6A standings and ranked seventh in the Associated Press 6A state poll.
Key to victory: Judson’s running game has been effective behind the trio of freshman Sincere McCormick, sophomore Jay Miller and junior Mi’kel Jackson. Those sets of legs are a big reason why Judson is averaging 6.8 yards per carry. The run game could play a factor on a night when storms are expected
Statistical leaders: Passing — Julon Williams 51-96-5 841 yards, 7 TDs; rushing — Jay Miller 67-577, 6 TDs; receiving — Dreshon Govan 6-254, 3 TDs; tackles — Dominique Ramsey , 52; sacks — Alton Robinson , 4; interceptions — Malik Taylor , 3.
Steele breakdown
Setting the scene: Steele is ranked fifth in the 6A AP poll and narrowly escaped last year’s contest with a one point win. The Knights avenged their lone regular-season loss from 2014 earlier with a win over DeSoto and have outscored district opponents 175-26. Steele returns many key skill players from last year’s team that reached the 6A-DI state semifinals. Steele and Judson are guaranteed to enter the same 6A playoff brackets because of their enrollments.
Key to victory: Steele’s passing attack could challenge Judson’s talented defensive backs. Junior quarterback Xavier Martin, junior receiver C.J. Williams and senior receiver Antoine Cox-Wesley have found success often. Martin and Cox-Wesley are both committed to Texas Tech . If the passing game is as effective as Steele’s stingy defense has been so far, the Knights could be in for another win over the Rockets.
Statistical leaders: Passing — Martin 84-121-1, 1,385 yards, 14 TDs; rushing — Bryson Denley 58-583, 14 TDs; receiving — Williams 31-628, 5 TDs; tackles — Jayden Jackson , 72; sacks — Mark Jackson, 6; interceptions — Isaiah Fields , 4.
E-N prediction
Steele 33, Judson 23: The outcome shouldn’t affect either team in its title aspirations. But Steele will show why a trip to Houston to play for its second state championship is a real possibility.
Ben Baby
